definition: between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: N. Korea charged U. S. reporters with spying.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮以間諜罪起訴美國記者。

sentences.english: He has been accused of spying.
sentences.chinese: 他被控犯有從事間諜罪。

sentences.english: They were charged with espionage or to foreign countries to provide "special services" crime.
sentences.chinese: 他們被控犯有間諜罪或爲外國提供“特殊服務”罪。

sentences.english: The 32-year-old freelance journalist was found guilty last month on charges of espionage.
sentences.chinese: 32歲的自由撰稿記者薩貝里上個月被判犯有間諜罪。

sentences.english: The government disclosed that another diplomat had been arrested for spy.
sentences.chinese: 政府透露，又有一名外交官因間諜罪被捕。

sentences.english: The maximum penalty for industrial espionage is 7 years.
sentences.chinese: 商業間諜罪的最高刑期可達7年。
